intro: Horkelia brevibracteata, commonly known as the short-bract horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Horkelia brevibracteata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
